In "blastseacuc.Rmd," I attempted a BLAST to Swiss-Prot of all my data.  
This took several days to complete. Due to end of quarter, I decided to select the
data that is significant (p-val<0.05). This is the 3 control groups and 3 30 degree C 
groups to run a BLAST and potentially save time. 

## Creating FASTA file from .fastq files of the statistically significantly different groups: 

Controls: SRR19635628, SRR19635629, SRR19635630. 
30degC treatment: SRR19635637, SRR19635638, SRR19635639. 


```{bash}
cat /home/shared/8TB_HDD_02/hannia/SeaCucumber/PRJNA848687_fasta/SRR19635628_1.fasta \
    /home/shared/8TB_HDD_02/hannia/SeaCucumber/PRJNA848687_fasta/SRR19635628_2.fasta \
    /home/shared/8TB_HDD_02/hannia/SeaCucumber/PRJNA848687_fasta/SRR19635629_1.fasta \
    /home/shared/8TB_HDD_02/hannia/SeaCucumber/PRJNA848687_fasta/SRR19635629_2.fasta \
    /home/shared/8TB_HDD_02/hannia/SeaCucumber/PRJNA848687_fasta/SRR19635630_1.fasta \
    /home/shared/8TB_HDD_02/hannia/SeaCucumber/PRJNA848687_fasta/SRR19635630_2.fasta \
     /home/shared/8TB_HDD_02/hannia/SeaCucumber/PRJNA848687_fasta/SRR19635637_1.fasta \
    /home/shared/8TB_HDD_02/hannia/SeaCucumber/PRJNA848687_fasta/SRR19635637_2.fasta \
    /home/shared/8TB_HDD_02/hannia/SeaCucumber/PRJNA848687_fasta/SRR19635638_1.fasta \
    /home/shared/8TB_HDD_02/hannia/SeaCucumber/PRJNA848687_fasta/SRR19635638_2.fasta \
    /home/shared/8TB_HDD_02/hannia/SeaCucumber/PRJNA848687_fasta/SRR19635639_1.fasta \
    /home/shared/8TB_HDD_02/hannia/SeaCucumber/PRJNA848687_fasta/SRR19635639_2.fasta \
    > /home/shared/8TB_HDD_02/hannia/SeaCucumber/output/seacuc_fastasignif.fasta
```

## running BLAST 

```{r, engine='bash'}
/home/shared/8TB_HDD_02/hannia/applications/ncbi-blast-2.16.0+/bin/blastx \
-query /home/shared/8TB_HDD_02/hannia/SeaCucumber/output/seacuc_fastasignif.fasta \
-db /home/shared/8TB_HDD_02/hannia/blast/uniprot_sprot_r2025_01 \
-out /home/shared/8TB_HDD_02/hannia/SeaCucumber/output/Seacucblast_signifresults.tab \
-evalue 1E-20 \
-num_threads 20 \
-max_target_seqs 5 \
-outfmt 6
```
